title: Disney reveals what Star Wars fans can expect on the new Galaxy's Edge Rise of the Resistance ride
text:
Disney has given Star Wars fans a taste of what they can expect on brand new ride Rise of the Resistance, coming soon to the Galaxy's Edge lands.

The attraction will take guests aboard a full-size transport shuttle before they are captured by a Star Destroyer and end up in the middle of a climatic battle between the First Order and Resistance.

And Disney says that the ride will 'blur the lines between fantasy and reality on a scale never seen before in a Disney attraction'.

Disney has given Star Wars fans a taste of what they can expect on brand new ride Rise of the Resistance, coming soon to the Galaxy's Edge lands. Pictured is the Rise of the Resistance hangar

The ride will begin with guests entering a transport ship to meet General Leia Organa at a secret rendezvous point.

But Disney adds: 'On their way to the hidden base, guests are intercepted and taken prisoner by the First Order as their ship is drawn into the hangar bay of a Star Destroyer.

'The action then ramps up as guests seek to escape the clutches of Kylo Ren and the First Order.'

During the attraction, guests will come face to face with characters including Resistance heroes Rey, Poe and Finn as well as Kylo Ren and General Hux of the First Order.

Disney says that the ride will 'blur the lines between fantasy and reality on a scale never seen before in a Disney attraction'. Above is a scene from the Rise of the Resistance trailer

Disney says Rise of the Resistance is one of the largest attractions it has ever created as it houses two full-sized At-At walkers and a Star Destroyer hangar bay - complete with a Tie fighter and a garrison of Stormtroopers. Above is a scene from the new ride's trailer

Disney adds that the ride is one of the largest attractions it has ever created as it houses two full-sized At-At walkers and a Star Destroyer hangar bay - complete with a Tie fighter and a garrison of Stormtroopers.

It will also combine multiple ride systems, as in one sequence of the ride, a new simulator experience will give the sensation to guests that they are falling from space to crash land on Batuu.

Meanwhile, during another portion of the experience, guests will race through a Star Destroyer in a trackless ride vehicle featuring an onboard droid that reacts to its surroundings.

Rise of the Resistance will join the Smugglers Run attraction at both Walt Disney World in Florida and Disneyland Resort in California. Pictured is Galaxy's Edge in California

Rise of the Resistance will make its debut at Walt Disney World in Florida on December 5 before being opened at Disneyland Resort in California on January 17, 2020.

The ride will join the Smugglers Run attraction, which is a massive replica of the Millennium Falcon and sees guests engage in a dogfight with Tie Fighters.

Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge in California reportedly cost $1billion to create. The 14-acre attraction has shops selling personal droids and lightsabers and 'Star Wars-appropriate food and drink'.
description: The attraction, coming to Disney parks in Florida and California, will see guests captured by a Star Destroyer and end up in the middle of a climatic battle between the First Order and Resistance.
